body_html:
I don't have a better idea for const since there are a few constraints:

  • We want to limit const things to attributes, otherwise we really can't stop people from re-assigning the value of a const
a = const(3)
....
a = const(4) # oops, we can't prevent this, but people might thing it should work
  • We need to ensure ScriptModule parent that calls a ScriptModule child actually owns child, otherwise we violate the invariant that ScriptModules can only call modules that are their children.

But I am open to other suggestions.
body_text:
I don't have a better idea for const since there are a few constraints:

We want to limit const things to attributes, otherwise we really can't stop people from re-assigning the value of a const

a = const(3)
....
a = const(4) # oops, we can't prevent this, but people might thing it should work


We need to ensure ScriptModule parent that calls a ScriptModule child actually owns child, otherwise we violate the invariant that ScriptModules can only call modules that are their children.

But I am open to other suggestions.
body:
I don't have a better idea for `const` since there are a few constraints:

* We want to limit const things to attributes, otherwise we really can't stop people from re-assigning the value of a const 
```
a = const(3)
....
a = const(4) # oops, we can't prevent this, but people might thing it should work
```

* We need to ensure ScriptModule `parent` that calls a ScriptModule `child` actually owns child, otherwise we violate the invariant that ScriptModules can only call modules that are their children.

But I am open to other suggestions.
